main.name: Credit Card Payment Default Predictions
main.description: For this project, three classification models are compared for predicting defaults on Credit Card payments: Random Forest, Decision Trees, and Logistic Regression

overview.title: Dataset and Library
overview.description1a: Scikit Learn's and PySpark's LogisticRegression, RandomForestClassifier, and DecisionTreeClassifier classes were used create each model.
overview.description1b: The dataset consisted of 30000 rows by 24 columns of client information and payment history, including the label which was the whether they defaulted on the next payment or not. However, the label is unbalanced with 23364 cases of payment and 6636 cases of defaulting.
